generalInfo:
This two week Namibia & Botswana tour offers the perfect introduction to these interesting and culturally unique countries. As well as a getting a glimpse of Zimbabwe and its most spectacular natural heritage site of Victoria Falls. Travelling in a small group on an overland truck specially designed for long trips through this wide variety of terrain, your journey starts in Namibia at its adventure hub of Swakopmund. If you arrive early you will have an option to take on a variety of experiences here from skydiving to sand boarding.

One of the cultural highlights of our time in Namibia is meeting the Himba people, semi-nomadic bush people who share with us some of the fascinating aspects of their lifestyles, from painting their skin with ochre and ask to communal pastoralism. After our time with the Himba, we head to the country’s celebrated Etosha National park. Here we spend two days taking in the Etosha Pan’s superb wildlife including lions, elephants and rhinos. Before heading into Botswana on day seven of the trip, we take some time in Namibia’s capital city of Windhoek.

Botswana boasts the most spectacular array of wildlife experiences, the first being the Okavango Delta where we spend three days. Before that we spend time with the San community in Ghanzi, thought to be ancestors of all the world’s human beings, due to their high genetic diversity. At Okavango, we explore the immense inland data on foot and by boat, taking in its network of winding channels and small forested islands. All of which act as a giant watering hole and feeding fest for 164 different mammal species. This is followed by a day at Chobe National Park, Botswana’s oldest park, which also has one of the highest densities of wildlife in Africa, especially elephant herds.

There are few better finales to a trip through southern Africa than at Zimbabwe’s Victoria Falls known locally as ‘Mosi-oa-Tunya’, which means ‘the smoke that thunders’.

**Important Note:** The itinerary below is written with an optional activity package so that you can pick and choose adventures according to your budget. You need to book these in advance so do chat to us about your interests.

dayInfo.description: Join the tour in Windhoek. Head to Etosha National Park This morning, you'll be met at the departure point by a representative who will transfer you to your first overnight stop near Etosha National Park. The shuttle service is expected to take between 4-5 hours and is exclusively for Nomad guests. The number of travellers will depend on the bookings. Just sit back, relax, and enjoy the drive to the Etosha National Park area. Upon arrival, your Nomad Tour Leader will greet you and get you acquainted with the tour, your truck, and your fellow travellers. Included Highlight

Travel from Etosha to Divundu Leaving the distinctive white sands of Etosha behind, our journey continues towards the Kavango River, bringing us into the immense Kavango-Zambezi Transfrontier Conservation Area (KAZA TFCA). This incredible area, one of the world's largest protected landscapes, spans five Southern African countries, and we'll traverse parts of it through Botswana and Zimbabwe, offering a glimpse into its vital role in supporting diverse wildlife and ecosystems; our overnight stop in Divundu provides the perfect introduction to this rich natural haven. Route

Divundu. Boat Cruise on the Kavango River This morning, we'll enjoy a leisurely boat cruise along the tranquil waters of the Kavango River. This is a chance to truly unwind and soak in the serene scenery, observing the vibrant birdlife that thrives along its banks. Keep your eyes peeled – you might even spot hippos lounging in the shallows or crocodiles basking in the sun. In the afternoon, you'll have the exciting opportunity to embark on an optional game drive into Mahangu National Park. Often considered a hidden gem, Mahangu is renowned for its rich biodiversity. It's a fantastic place for wildlife viewing, with frequent sightings of large herds of elephants and buffalo. You can also expect to see various species of antelope, and if luck is on our side, even some of the elusive big cats like lion or leopard. This drive offers a superb chance to immerse ourselves further in the incredible wildlife of the Kavango-Zambezi Transfrontier Conservation Area. Included Highlight

Cross in to Botswana and head to Maun, gateway to the Okavango Delta Leaving Namibia, we'll then cross the border into Botswana, a country celebrated for its commiment to conservation and its spectacular wilderness areas. Our destination for the evening is Maun, a bustling, vibrant town often referred to as the gateway to the iconic Okavango Delta. Maun itself sits on the Thamalakane River, which is an outflow of the Delta, offering a taste of the unique watery landscapes to come. We'll spend the night here, giving us a chance to relax and prepare before our highly anticipated adventure into the heart of the Okavango Delta tomorrow. Route

Okavango - Khwai Conservation Area (Okavango Delta) For the next two nights, you'll be separated from your main truck as we venture deeper into the Okavango Delta. Before we depart from Maun, it's really important that you pack a small bag with only the personal belongings you'll need for these two nights. Please remember to pack lightly – space will be limited, and you'll appreciate not carrying excess weight. Your accommodation in the Khwai Conservation Area can best be described as a rustic mobile fly camp. You'll be staying in a comfortable Meru-style tent, which is equipped with two single beds. Each tent also boasts adjoining en-suite amenities, including a bucket shower system for a refreshing wash and a chemical toilet for your convenience. Today, our journey truly begins as we make our way towards the heart of the Okavango Delta. For early risers, there's an incredible opportunity to experience an optional scenic flight over the Delta. This offers a breathtaking aerial perspective of the labyrinthine waterways, islands, and floodplains, providing an unparalleled view of this natural wonder (please note, this is dependent on time and suitable weather conditions). After your optional flight, or if you choose not to fly, you'll be collected from Maun and transferred to the Khwai Conservation Area in smaller, more agile safari-type vehicles. This ensures we can navigate the varied terrain effectively. Upon arrival, our experienced guide will provide a comprehensive briefing, preparing us for what to expect during our exciting afternoon mokoro excursion into the Okavango Delta. These traditional dugout canoes offer a unique and peaceful way to explore the Delta's pristine channels. (Please note

Moremi Game Reserve Today is dedicated to an exhilarating full-day game drive as we spend most of our time on safari within the renowned Moremi Game Reserve. Get ready for an adventure as we traverse this incredible wilderness area in our robust 4x4 vehicles. Be prepared for some bumpy roads – it's all part of the authentic safari experience as we navigate the diverse terrain. Moremi is a truly exceptional reserve, celebrated for its rich ecosystems and abundant wildlife. It offers a mosaic of habitats, ranging from serene wetlands and expansive open water to vast grasslands and dense Savannah woodland. This incredible variety means we have the chance to encounter a wide array of species. We'll be actively searching for the magnificent fauna that roam these plains, including large herds of elephants, a variety of antelope, and perhaps even the elusive big cats like lions, leopards, or cheetahs. Keep an eye out for giraffes, zebras, and many other fascinating creatures. The diverse flora of the reserve is equally captivating, adding to the beauty of the landscape. As the sun begins to set, we'll make our way back to our camp in Khwai. This evening, we'll have the perfect opportunity to relax, share stories, and compare all the amazing sightings and memorable moments from our day on safari in Moremi. It's a fantastic chance to relive the excitement with your fellow travellers. Route

Heading from Khwai to Nata Today we'll be travelling from Khwai to Nata, a journey that takes us past Botswana's incredible salt pans. We'll pack up our camp and depart at first light in our open 4x4 safari vehicles, soaking in the early morning wilderness. These smaller vehicles allow us to navigate the terrain effectively before we reconnect with our main Nomad truck in Maun. The scenic drive from Maun to Nata offers a fantastic opportunity to witness some of Botswana's truly breathtaking landscapes and get a feel for its rich cultural heritage. As we travel, keep your eyes peeled – there's always a chance of a wildlife encounter or two along the way. You might spot various antelope, zebras, or even some larger game as they roam the unfenced areas. Our destination for the night is Nata, where we'll settle in after a day of diverse scenery and potential wildlife sightings. Route
Nata to Kasane - Chobe National Park Today, we journey from the fascinating Kalahari sands of Nata to Kasane, a vibrant town strategically located at the convergence of four countries

Zimbabwe - Victoria Falls With the incredible memories of our recent wildlife encounters firmly etched in our minds, we embark on the final leg of our journey today. This morning, we'll cross the border into Zimbabwe and travel the short distance to the iconic town of Victoria Falls. Today is dedicated to experiencing the truly spectacular Victoria Falls, known locally by the evocative name of "Mosi-oa-Tunya" – "the smoke that thunders." You'll have the opportunity to visit this natural wonder at your leisure, taking your time to explore the various viewpoints and witness the sheer power of the mighty Zambezi River as it plunges dramatically into the Batoka Gorge below. The roar of the water and the spray that rises hundreds of metres into the air are an awe-inspiring sight, truly living up to its local name. While much of today is rightly dedicated to viewing the Falls, the bustling adventure town of Victoria Falls also offers a wide range of optional activities for those seeking an extra dose of adrenaline in the afternoon. Options can include thrilling helicopter flights over the Falls, white-water rafting on the Zambezi, or even bungee jumping. For the more relaxed traveller, there are charming craft markets to explore, offering local artworks and souvenirs, alongside inviting coffee shops where you can simply unwind and soak in the atmosphere. This evening, you have the option to join the group for a delightful optional dinner at a local restaurant. This is a wonderful chance to savour a delicious meal, share stories from your incredible journey, and reflect on the day's awe-inspiring experiences at Victoria Falls with your fellow travellers. Your guide will be happy to arrange a booking for those who wish to participate. Route

Tour ends at Victoria Falls Your tour officially comes to an end after breakfast today. With a wealth of activities on offer in Victoria Falls, this is the perfect day to tailor an adventure that most suits your style. Whether you're keen to experience the thrill of white-water rafting on the mighty Zambezi River or prefer to enjoy a breathtaking scenic flight over the iconic Victoria Falls, today is yours to make the most of the many attractions this vibrant town offers. Included Highlight
